posts.post_content:
Everyone is pointing out the combo with [Kaalia](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Kaalia), but no-one has mentioned another card from the same Commander deck as her that combos great with Gisela. [Pyrohemia](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Pyrohemia). Get both on the table and it's "R: Pyrohemia deals 2 damage to each opponent and each creature they control, and no damage to you or your creatures".  
  
Edit: ClowWizardEriol, the damage prevented is rounded up. Rounding up 1/2 a point of damage prevented equals 1 point of damage prevented, thus she prevents all the damage [Pyrohemia](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Pyrohemia) would deal to you and creatures you control.
posts.html:
Everyone is pointing out the combo with Kaalia, but no-one has mentioned another card from the same Commander deck as her that combos great with Gisela. Pyrohemia. Get both on the table and it's "R: Pyrohemia deals 2 damage to each opponent and each creature they control, and no damage to you or your creatures".

Edit: ClowWizardEriol, the damage prevented is rounded up. Rounding up 1/2 a point of damage prevented equals 1 point of damage prevented, thus she prevents all the damage Pyrohemia would deal to you and creatures you control.

Posted By: TrueKitsonga (5/3/2012 8:53:17 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
I've been waiting for this card.  
  
I'm a R/W player, through and through, and this card just makes me happier than I can probably express.  
  
It was depressing to go through Innistrad and Dark Ascension, with their arbitrary decision to focus on ally colored cards and to ignore enemy colored cards. But, this single card manages to make up for all of that.  
  
It's a legendary mythic creature. Effectively the highest tier a creature can exist in, and the first R/W one ever printed. And, it actually pushes the boundaries of just how powerful a creature can be, being a virtual 10/10 first strike flyer for seven mana, which alone would be tremendously powerful but her abilities extend far, far beyond that.  
  
When you throw in the fact that she's a beautiful angel, I'm just so happy that this card exists. It's like I've been rewarded for not giving up hope, which I guess is the core theme of Avacyn Restored.
posts.html:
I've been waiting for this card.

I'm a R/W player, through and through, and this card just makes me happier than I can probably express.

It was depressing to go through Innistrad and Dark Ascension, with their arbitrary decision to focus on ally colored cards and to ignore enemy colored cards. But, this single card manages to make up for all of that.

It's a legendary mythic creature. Effectively the highest tier a creature can exist in, and the first R/W one ever printed. And, it actually pushes the boundaries of just how powerful a creature can be, being a virtual 10/10 first strike flyer for seven mana, which alone would be tremendously powerful but her abilities extend far, far beyond that.

When you throw in the fact that she's a beautiful angel, I'm just so happy that this card exists. It's like I've been rewarded for not giving up hope, which I guess is the core theme of Avacyn Restored.

posts.post_content:
She gives Razia a run for her money.  
But why bit them against ech other when can you use BOTH?  
They work decent toghether actually. Gisela yield Razia that she NOT made of cardboard (duh) and Razia's can actually smack meanies on another side of the board for a whooping six!  
  
Also it's note worthy that her first ability is kinda political in multiplayer, with opponents smacking each other for double damage.  
  
It's nice knowing that with that angel lady and [Slayer's Stronghold](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Slayer's Stronghold) (and mabe, mabe other shinies in Return to Ravnica?) Boros can hit a buck once again.

Posted By: Gilae (4/28/2013 10:41:57 AM)

posts.post_content: An absolutely incredible card. Even if its third and fourth abilities only affected damage dealt to and by itself, it would still be a 10/10 flying first strike for 7 cost. You don't need to run cards that become absolutely insane with her (although there are plenty such as [Manabarbs](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Manabarbs), [Pyrohemia](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Pyrohemia), and of course [Heartless Hidetsugu](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Heartless Hidetsugu) who now reads: {T}: Every player other than you loses all of their life if their life total is even and all but one of their life if their life total is odd. You lose one quarter of your life, rounded down.) because she can single-handedly win you many games, and the rest can usually be won with whatever would already be on the field and her.
posts.html:

posts.post_content: Gisela was so good but she is outclassed by [Aurelia, the Warleader](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Aurelia, the Warleader). The comparisons are fair because both allow the team to deal double damage but Gisela can half the damage you receive while Aurelia can attack the turn she comes into play and has Vigilance. Its a tough call but Aurelia beats out Gisela by 1 turn and has Haste. So Aurelia is capable of 6 damage by her lonesome on turn 6, while Gisela has to wait till turn 7 to deal 10 damage, whereas turn 7 Aurelia will have deal 12 damage, the comparison favors Aurelia and her A-team.
posts.html:
Gisela was so good but she is outclassed by Aurelia, the Warleader. The comparisons are fair because both allow the team to deal double damage but Gisela can half the damage you receive while Aurelia can attack the turn she comes into play and has Vigilance. Its a tough call but Aurelia beats out Gisela by 1 turn and has Haste. So Aurelia is capable of 6 damage by her lonesome on turn 6, while Gisela has to wait till turn 7 to deal 10 damage, whereas turn 7 Aurelia will have deal 12 damage, the comparison favors Aurelia and her A-team.
